text: Ernst Kalwitzki (3 October 1909 – 3 February 1991) was a German footballer who played as a right winger. He played from 1933 until 1943 for FC Schalke 04. He won six German championships and one national cup with the club. In the 1939 German championship final, he scored five goals in Schalke's 9–0 victory over Admira Vienna. == Honours == ;Schalke 04 *German Championship: 1934, 1935, 1937, 1939, 1940, 1942 *German Cup: 1937 ==References== ==External links== * Category:1909 births Category:1991 deaths Category:Association football forwards Category:German footballers Category:FC Schalke 04 players Category:Sportspeople from Gelsenkirchen
title: Ernst Kalwitzki
